questions.questionText: What is the interval between C and E?
questions.hint: A major third consists of four half steps.
questions.explanation: The interval from C to E is a major third because it spans four half steps.

questions.questionText: Which of these notes completes the ascending C major scale?
questions.hint: The C major scale follows C-D-E-F-G-A-?
questions.explanation: The C major scale consists of the notes C, D, E, F, G, A, and B.

questions.questionText: What is the interval between F and A?
questions.hint: Count the number of half steps between F and A.
questions.explanation: The interval between F and A is a major third because it consists of four half steps.

questions.questionText: Which of these notes is part of the A minor scale?
questions.hint: A minor is the relative minor of C major.
questions.explanation: The A minor scale consists of A, B, C, D, E, F, and G.

questions.questionText: Which note is displayed on the treble clef?
questions.hint: This note is on the bottom line of the treble clef.
questions.explanation: E is the first line note in the treble clef.

questions.questionText: Listen to the audio and identify the note.
questions.hint: This note is on the second line of the treble clef.
questions.explanation: G is the second line note in the treble clef.

questions.questionText: Which of these is a minor scale?
questions.hint: This scale shares the same notes as C major.
questions.explanation: A minor is the relative minor of C major and uses the same notes.

questions.questionText: What is the interval between G and D?
questions.hint: A perfect fifth consists of seven half steps.
questions.explanation: The interval between G and D is a perfect fifth because it spans seven half steps.

questions.questionText: Which note comes next in the sequence: C, E, G, __?
questions.hint: This is part of a C major chord arpeggio.
questions.explanation: The notes C, E, G, and B form a C major seventh chord arpeggio.

questions.questionText: Which of these is a major sixth interval?
questions.hint: A major sixth consists of nine half steps.
questions.explanation: The interval from C to A is a major sixth because it spans nine half steps.
